meanings.definition: Having a rank, unpleasant, stale smell or taste.
meanings.sent1: The rancid milk made me scrunch up my nose.
meanings.sent2: The old cheese had a rancid odor that filled the room.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally ate a rancid cookie and made a funny face.
meanings.sent4: The rancid smell in the fridge was like a cloud of yuckiness.
meanings.sent5: The rancid meat was so gross, I could almost taste it in the air.

meanings.sent1: The rancid fruit was covered in mold.
meanings.sent2: The meat had turned rancid after being left out for days.
meanings.sent3: The rancid sandwich was so bad, even the dog wouldn't eat it.
meanings.sent4: The rancid smell of failure lingered in the air.
meanings.sent5: The rancid milk curdled in the sun, creating a foul mess.
